alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Escambia; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, north central Baldwin, southeastern Washington, south central Clarke and northwestern Escambia Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 226 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of McIntosh, or 16 miles south of Jackson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McCullough and McIntosh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Escambia; Monroe; Washington
